Reviews.Content: No Dice Folks ... Well, to be completely honest, I don鈥檛 know where to begin. I literally burst out laughing when I realized The Orange Tulip had landed itself on tripadvisor.com. I want to start this review by saying that I am not a difficult lady to please. Let鈥檚 start at the beginning!!I wound up staying at the Orange Tulp, not the Orange Tulip, as the 鈥淚鈥?was not evident in the sign. The first thing I noticed was the bags, upon bags, of garbage that graced the front door of the hotel. I felt a little worried at that point, but I figured its Amsterdam, and it鈥檚 not that big of a deal. I had seen photos of the hotel, so I felt okay walking into the situation. There is a ridiculous amount of stairs. Very narrow stairs. I had trouble maneuvering up them, and I鈥檓 a small girl. There is a lot of stairs. We counted and the total number of narrow stairs to our 鈥渉otel room鈥?was 87. Yip, 87 stairs, after exploring a city all day is rough. Check in was easy. The staff was friendly enough. But, I only stayed one day, and that was our only interaction with the staff, so I can鈥檛 really speak on how great or lack there of, they are.So, 87 narrow stairs later, we get to our 鈥渉otel room鈥? I use quotes every time I write 鈥渉otel room鈥?because; it was far from a hotel room. It was a disgusting square of walls that magically contained 4 beds. It was small. Really small!! There was also absolutely no view. I鈥檓 not kidding when I say there was MOULD on the walls, on the baseboards. There was no washroom in the room, only a communal washroom down the hall. (Actually downstairs, and down the hall, as that once we unlocked the door to the room, there was another flight of stairs that brought us to the attic). The washroom was the most disgusting, vile room I鈥檝e ever seen in my life. I backpacked through Europe, and stayed in hostels, and a couple great hotels, and a couple AWFUL hotels. This one, by far, took the cake. This is a list of the things that were included in the shower room: mould, dirty boxers, hair all over the floor, and hair ties, and whatnot. The water was cold. It smelled like it hadn鈥檛 been washed in about a month. The toilet room was worse. It smelled worse, had slightly more mould, and actually made me sick to my stomach. This was a year and a half ago, and every now and then the girls and I will still burst out laughing about this 鈥渉otel room鈥? The bed sheets did look brand new, but the beds were really uncomfortable. If I can give you one piece of advice, book elsewhere. It鈥檚 not even that cheap, we paid like 50 bucks Canadian each for one night 鈥?so 200.00 Canadian for the room a night 鈥?honestly, you can do better.We were worried the entire time about getting toxic mould from our 鈥渉otel room鈥? And, that is something that you should never worry about.
Reviews.Author: Siobhan1983

Reviews.Content: saver to stay outside stairs were black with dirt , landing tiles with holes,smell of peerooms were small, dirty .and the curtins not on the rails there was no safe will never be BACK
Reviews.Author: fatboy2000

Reviews.Content: The worst hotel I have ever seen in my whole life A hotel to avoid at all cost!!! When you arrive at the hotel, you are greeted with filthy stairs leading up to a less than welcoming reception. The corridors smelt of urine. When we finally saw the room, we immediately concluded we could not stay a minute longer in that hotel. The bed was disgusting, cockroaches were crawling on the floor and the bathroom looked unhygienic. The receptionist was sympathetic but said he could not issue a refund. He said they were getting complaints all the time but the owner was not doing anything about it. We asked if it was worth speaking to the manager but he said it wouldn't get us our money back. We lost our prepaid two nights, but decided to cut our losses and move to another hotel.
Reviews.Author: sderone

Reviews.Content: Avoid! The Orange Tulip was a huge disappointment. I booked a room there because the location seemed great, and the hotel's website promised a cozy room at a really good price. I was looking for something simple, clean and affordable. What I found was more like a prison room that hadn't been cleaned for a while, with a very questionable bed spread and a shower head over the toilet. When I complained, the receptionist told me this was my only option. There was no way I would stay in that room - not just because it was awful, but also because it was very much not the room they promised. After the receptionist refused to refund my deposit, I talked to the manager on the phone and tried to explain what happened. He was much less polite than the receptionist. I've never experienced such rude service. In the end, I left. Without my money, but with the hope for finding clean sheets somewhere for the night.
Reviews.Author: jwzest

Reviews.Content: below par I stayed here 2 years ago and am reminded of the stay as I was recently in Amsterdam again and stayed at a much nicer place.I find this hotel absolutely horrible. Terrible location (nothing nice about the Damrack!) dirty  noisy. I requested a room change when they assigned me one of the noisy threadbare rooms facing the street, and I paid dearly for it. In the end it wasn't even cheap. I also found a dead slug on my bedspread (no joke) and threw the bedspread on the floor, and everyday it was put back on the bed, complete with slug.The bathroom was clean, the sheets were cleanish - but I found the carpet, furniture, and blankets filthy, as were the stairs...Also very noisy with people coming any going all night. I look back on that stay with horror....
Reviews.Author: Borislondon

Reviews.Content: Rude restaurant staff! Just back from 3 nights in amsterdam. I suppose the best thing to say about this hotel is you get what you pay for. The stairs are very steep and hard to manouvre but upon check in and check out someone carried our bags for us. The staff at reception were fairly friendly and helpful. The restaurant downstairs is the main drawback, the staff are very rude and on the 2 mornings that we got breakfast there we were charged extra even though breakfast was supposed to be included in the price of the hotel. They didnt tell us this at the time it was only when we were leaving the hotel that the staff on reception presented us with the bill, we felt like criminals! In general its an ok place to stay, the rooms are clean but basic. The whole place could do with a facelift but its in a great location.
Reviews.Author: irishgirl2008

Reviews.Content: Value for money... great location! For the money we paid for this hotel it was absolutely perfect. It was the first stop on a tour of Europe and things couldn鈥檛 have been easier. The hotel is a 5 min walk away from the train station鈥?(the main train station is half hour train journey from the airport). It is on the very central 鈥淒amrak鈥?which is in the middle of everything. You have red light district a ten min walk away, Anne Frank house in walking distance and everything else really.We got breakfast included and the staff seemed nice enough鈥?our room was average size.. the lighting was poor in the room and the TV broke and we had a view of a pile of abandoned tables and chairs but none of this bothered us鈥?we were out most of the day and happy to have a quite room rather than a room with a view and a lot of noise.If I went back to Amsterdam I would definitely stay here I think because it was very reasonable and perfect place to crash out and get a peaceful sleep in the heart of the Dam.
Reviews.Author: Stephen&Gemma

Reviews.Content: luggage stolen inside the hotel We arrived at 11am and the room wasnt ready yet. So we left our luggages at the reception. We came back 2 hours later, and then we noticed that one of our two bags have been stolen from the reception.The hotel didn't want to take any responsability.We spent the rest of the day calling our insurance, at the police station, or waiting for the manager to look at the security camera recordings, on which he never found anything mysteriously.
Reviews.Author: Laely

Reviews.Content: Simply Avoid The hotel is sitauted above a restaurant, decent location from the train station though (about 2 minutes walk). To get into the hotel lobby you have to walk up a very narrow and steep staircase. We checked in a few hours early and we're allowed to leave our bags at our own risk in the very crampt hotel lobby. There was a dodgy high shelf bundled with other bags where we also left ours!Our room was situated on the top floor which meant carrying our bags/suitcases up and down a few flights of very narrow stairs again as there wasn't a lift.The room was for 3 people and was tiny. You couldn't really stand between the beds. The shower room was just a wet room, however the tiles were manky and grimey. There wasn't even a basin to put your feet.The balcony just outside out room door was full up with what looked like old room fittings etc. There were old toilets, sinks and various other buidling materials there.On the plus side the TV worked!
Reviews.Author: jimbo_online

Reviews.Content: Quirky but OK Quirky little place, half way down Damrak between Central Station and Dam Square.The hotel is set above a restaurant with a side entrance and steep, narrow, twisting staircases. The beds are clean, you get cable TV (original All Creatures Great and Small, nightly!) and breakfast in the restaurant is included.English speaking staff as in most of Holland.Good value at 70 euro for a double/twin including breakfast and a great location in the heart of the city.
Reviews.Author: shantyjohn

Reviews.Content: Friendly hotel, OK for single women travellers I stayed here for 4 nights when I went to a conference. The rooms were clean (although bed linen was bit threadbare) and the receptionists were all hugely friendly and helpful. I was travelling alone and felt completely safe at the hotel. The rooms were cleaned daily.I also found the restaurant staff friendly: they introduced me to the hotel cat (Gato), who sat with me at breakfast purring away.It was a bit noisy on the Damrak but the hotel have no control over that.
Reviews.Author: JunoUK

Reviews.Content: Never Again !! Dirty place (stairs, lobby area and room)great location (5 mins away frm central station), Very NoisyFriendly and helpfull receptionistsRestaurant staff very rude and made me feel like a beggar to have my breakfast !!!!
Reviews.Author: syd_gay

Reviews.Content: Cheap and Cheerful I booked this hotel as part of a birthday weekend away with some mates. I wanted somewhere cheap and cheerful in the centre of Amsterdam which was not a hostel and this place fitted the bill perfectly.Located on 5 minutes from Central Station it was very convienent and easy to find. The rooms were basic but clean. They came with an ensuite toilet/shower and towels and bed linen. As the hotel is situated on Dam Rak, the front rooms are quiet noisy but this was to be expected.The staff were very friendly and helpful. There is even a lovely hotel cat in reception to greet you.This hotel was perfect for the weekend and good value for money if you want somewhere in between a hostel and a hotel.
Reviews.Author: tiffanyblue

Reviews.Content: No me gust贸 el Orange Tulip de Amsterdam   showReview(15719180, 'full');
Reviews.Author: julenDonostia
